Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed (almost completely worn); exterior reserved with streaky orange band at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Bands on the cul of chalices appear as early as 610BC and last until circa 550BC.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0703) (phase 2)
